message.content: A Tennessee couple, Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy, have denied allegations that they exploited NFL player Michael Oher for their own benefit. They argued that referring to Oher as their adopted son was only in a colloquial sense and not intended to have any legal implications. The couple also stated that they never signed any professional football contracts for Oher, and he was content with the financial arrangements from the movie "The Blind Side." Additionally, they claimed that the NCAA allowed Oher to attend the University of Mississippi if he was considered part of the Tuohy family. Oher had previously accused the couple of falsely representing themselves as his adoptive parents.

A Tennessee couple, Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy, denied allegations that they exploited former NFL player Michael Oher for their own benefit. They stated that the term "adopted son" was used colloquially and not with legal implications. The couple also claimed that they never signed any pro football contracts for Oher and that he was satisfied with their financial arrangements from the movie "The Blind Side." Additionally, the filing mentioned that the NCAA allowed Oher to attend the University of Mississippi if he was part of the Tuohy family. Oher had accused the couple of falsely representing themselves as his adoptive parents.
